snippet: An op-ed article Mr. Paul wrote for The Washington Times on mandatory minimum prison sentences appears to have copied language from an essay in The Week.
abstract: Sen Rand Paul of Kentucky, who has had to explain how Wikipedia entries came to be incorporated into his speeches with no attribution, faces charges of direct plagiarism; op-ed article Paul wrote for The Washington Times on mandatory minimum prison sentences appears to have copied language from an essay in magazine The Week.
lead_paragraph: An op-ed article Mr. Paul wrote for The Washington Times on mandatory minimum prison sentences appears to have copied language from an essay in The Week.

headline.main: Senator Rand Paul Faces New Charges of Plagiarism
headline.print_headline: Senator Paul Faces New Charges of Plagiarism
